page.title: 07MINING
page.content: A mine is a road way driven from the surface at a pre-determined grid. The road ways of the Bogside Mine travel under our area. There are a few air shafts which are shown on our Ordnance Survey Map which indicates the extent of the planning consent of the mine.The mine is no longer producing coal but a staff of forty three still maintain the mine. The coal still contained under ground is reckoned to be of high quality. Also in our area are two bings. Bings are heaps of residue from mine workings. These are unsightly to look at but the N.C.B. have plans to landscape the area again once the mining is exhausted. Pathways follow up the bings to deposit the residue on the top until the bing is completed and conical in shape.
